campaign.story:
An era of Nintendo Magazines (again)
In a newsagent far, far away they used to sell Nintendo magazines. These incredible publications once existed in numerous quantities before the smelly internet came along and made them unviable. So the big corporate publishers packed their bags and shut the doors on these long-revered Nintendo gaming mags. Sad times.
There are those that still think that Nintendo has a place on bits of dead trees, which is where we come in. After a very successful Kickstarter campaign for our first issue, Ninty Fresh is back for a second dose!
In the olden times, Nintendo fans garnered their knowledge and wisdom from print magazines. There are far too many to mention here, but personal favourites of ours included Mean Machines (before it evolved like a Pokémon into Nintendo Magazine System), Total!, Super Play, Cube, NGamer and of course the Official Nintendo Magazine itself. These magazines were bursting with passion, knowledge and coverage for the consoles that we loved so dearly. Overseas readers will no doubt remember their own (sometimes official) publications, such as the legendary Nintendo Power.
Our first attempt at making a Nintendo magazine went down very well indeed, so we thought we'd do it all over again. 
Just like old Nintendo magazines
So, what's this then?
With no Nintendo magazines at all in the UK since 2014 and the recent demise of corporate multi-format publications in general (like GamesMaster and GamesTM) there's a huge lack of Nintendo coverage in print form. Whilst there are enthusiast ventures available, we craved something that completely covered and encompassed Nintendo's vast history. Something that looks at the retro aspect as well as the new, with a fresh perspective on things. So, we thought we would make one: Ninty Fresh. Something that will cater for ALL of Nintendo. From NES to Now. Or, in this case, SNES to Now!
Ninty Fresh? What's that all about?
Capturing what the magazine is about with the added benefit of a cheeky pun, the title Ninty Fresh tells you right from the get-go what we want to do. Imagine, if you will, a cross between EMAP's Nintendo Official Magazine, Future's Official Nintendo Magazine and a dash of Retro Gamer and NGamer and that's what we hope to be bringing, all with that Nintendo flavour and familiarity that older magazines brought you. But in 2020. And obviously, with no affiliation to those amazing magazines.
Making your own magazine without advertising support or huge corporate backing is challenging, but since the first one went down so well, we came back. The second issue of Ninty Fresh is going to be another A4 (210mmx297mm) page turner with a smorgasbord of Nintendo content crammed into 84 pages. And no adverts. Again.
Inspired by the past
What will be in it?
Much like our first issue, these are intended to be themed. This one will feature F-Zero. Nintendo may have long-abandoned the franchise, but given that it's been 30 years since the first game launched in Japan, we've crammed loads of content about the franchise into this issue. All SIX core games, the anime, games like F-Zero and the appearance of the franchise in other games. Plus, courtesy of the legendary Chris Scullion, an extensive F-Zero X retrospective.
On top of that, we plan to bring a range of enjoyable content to each issue. We will have editorials looking at the latest big Nintendo story and what's happened since the last issue, system recaps, informative interviews and huge cover features, all interwoven with amazing artwork, the latest reviews and even some fun and games! Oh, and fan content. We want your stuff. Letters (or emails), tweets, questions, artwork - all that sort of thing. We will be in touch closer to the launch with more details about those bits.
We've already got Matthew Castle (former ONM Editor) on board for an interview, coverage of the LEGO NES and the LEGO x Super Mario, a Game Boy Retrospective and a huge look at Pokémon Yellow.
Everything for this second issue is either in progress, already completed or awaiting release (reviews); we'd say around 50% of the content is already prepared. We've also taken on THREE new staff writers to enhance the quality of our writing.
Phillip took a break from manual handling to produce this masterpiece for us
That cover looks amazing!
Thanks! After such a stunning piece of artwork last time, we wanted something equally as stunning for this one and we've teamed up with Phil Summers. He's the creator of “Hand-Drawn Game Guides”, and his most recent work includes the  acclaimed hand-drawn “The Legend of Zelda" guide. He has been hard at work to deliver you a cover that is inspired by the classic F-Zero Super Famicom cover of old, giving it a unique spin whilst retaining the feeling of classic F-Zero. Dripping with style, the new artwork is both a tribute to this amazing franchise but also a testament to Phil's amazing ability to capture the glory of hand-drawn game art.
 Phil's work on Nintendo Life 
Some examples of Phil's awesomeness
When will it come out?
We are targeting a November release for this, but we will keep you posted. Obviously, we are already hard at work putting this all together - much like last time, around 50% of it is already completed. The release ultimately depends on whether it gets funded and when the funds are processed, but we are hoping to start shipping these out before the end of November.
Funding Target
Speaking of funding, our target of £2500 will ensure that an 84-page print issue will be produced. However, we hope that we can make something much bigger in the future, if enough people support it and show that there's demand. Helping us to produce this second issue gives us the platform and scope to make this evolve even more and we can make this even beefier.
As we said, we're already in discussions with folks that used to be involved with Nintendo magazines and really want to be able to bring their fantastic writing back where it belongs - in print. We hope that this will be around for the long-haul; in fact, even our spines are being designed so that they'll make a pretty picture when put together. We'd need a fair few successful issues to achieve that!
If you like the sound of what we are doing, we have physical and digital options available, and some more premium levels if you really want to help this project come to life. Please help us get a print Nintendo magazine back into people's hands.
Stretch Goals
84 pages is the target for this issue, but we are really hoping to add even more content and get as high as 116 (!) pages! Here's what you'll get added if you help us reach these targets.
A nice and easy one to start with, we'll go to 92 pages if we hit £5,000 in funding. That's nearly 10% bigger than issue 1. We'll make some of the features bigger and to be honest, we could do with the space.
What, you want even more? No problem! Help us to reach £7,500 and we will instantly increase NFM02 to 100 pages. That will mean that you will get a THIRD retrospective in the form of Goldeneye for the Nintendo 64. And means our second issue will have almost 20% more girth!
The reward for hitting £10,000 will be that EVERYONE at print and above (£6+) will get a double-sided poster of the cover art and inside welcome artwork. If you are already getting the poster, we will simply send you two. Then you don't need to choose which side to show off!
This is going to look amazing on your wall!
Ozcan, aka "Oskunk", is a French artist based in Paris. Video games, mangas, comics and graffiti have always been a significant part of his life and are also a great source of inspiration. Oskunk is known for working with such brands as “PlayStation”, “Ubisoft”, "Warner Bros.” and many more, delivering his custom and well known street-art style. For this stretch goal, Oskunk will create a “Captain Falcon” themed art print (A4) that will be included with every print issue.
 The design is pending but as you can see by the examples below, it's going to be something special!
Examples of Oskunk's work. Please help us make this for you!
Our final stretch target (for now) will be at £20,000 and will result in ANOTHER 16 pages coming your way, making for a huge magazine! This will allow us to dedicate far more space to amazing Nintendo content, including a Wii Sports Resort retrospective and "Games We Loved" and "Games We Hated" style pieces. You know you want to see Superman 64 in there!
How can you help?
For starters, even supporting our little thing is humbling. Whether you pledge for a PDF version of the magazine, the print copy, or one of the heavier tiers, your support is what will make this happen. We absolutely love Nintendo and its games, and just want to make something that brings more of that content to more eyes. Beyond that, sharing this Kickstarter, telling your friends and pushing it far and wide. The more people supporting this, the more likely it'll not only become a reality, but allow us to make something even better and bigger in the future. And perhaps even more regular.
And, as noted in some of the masses of words above, we will need your letters (emails), and tweets. Pictures and stuff. These magazines in the past were almost communities within themselves. We want to try to build something like that.We are forever seeing people lament the loss of Nintendo magazines. This is your chance to ensure one gets made.

PLAY

 During the 2020 Covid-19 crisis, the comics community saw our beloved retailers struggling to keep their shops going. From "shelter-in-place" orders to economic uncertainty, business owners were left without much support. Not only has the pandemic negatively impacted their livelihood, but it's compromised what all of us need these days: a safe space. 
For many, comic book stores are a place of acceptance, joy, and discovery. This is particularly important for people of marginalized genders who might not have access to other inclusive places with like-minded individuals, which means it's specifically important to provide assistance to comic book stores owned, operated, and staffed by women and people of marginalized genders.
That's where INSIDER ART came in. Developed by Shelly Bond, INSIDER ART assembled 150 women and non-binary comics creators from around the world. This 270-page digital anthology raised over $5K on Gumroad, with all of the proceeds benefiting 28 retailers who reached out for support. And now with your help, we want to bring a softcover version of the book to everyone. 
While the digital version of INSIDER ART will remain exclusively on Gumroad, we've had many requests for a softcover for people who prefer a paperback reading experience. With your help, we'll be able to provide this astounding 4-color compendium for print-lovers to enjoy and as a bonus, pay the 150 creatives who generously donated their time and talents.
"...a joyous celebration of graphic narrative in a multiplicity of forms...much of the appeal of INSIDER ART is in rooting through its eclectic treasure chest of graphic gems...INSIDER ART could be considered one of the key releases of 2020." 
 —Andy Oliver, Broken Frontier
Chock-full of comics, crafts, and cats, INSIDER ART was designed to entertain readers of all ages who are stuck indoors or just in search of new creative outlets. When your four walls have become too familiar, you can open a book and be welcomed into ours.
In our house, you will find eight different rooms:  basement, bedroom, kitchen, attic, bathroom, craft room, living room, and garage. Each room is filled with comics, prose, and projects individually curated by a team of eight editors designed to inspire readers and remind everyone why being inside isn't so bad.

Planet Comics is a new, 40+ page, full-color, oversized comic anthology that pays homage to the original 1940s pulp magazine.
Issue #1 regular cover by Pietro
From 1940 through 1953, Fiction House published the first comic dedicated exclusively to science fiction: Planet Comics! This anthology title featured futuristic stories of heroic adventurers with a mid-century aesthetic, and it is well-loved to this day, often for its lush, high-quality, imaginative covers. Just look at this winner from issue 71: 
Planet Comics #71 from 1953
Hey everyone! My name’s Jeff McClelland, and I write comics like The Tick and the 2019 Kickstarter-funded Black Terror: Social Insecurity. With this new iteration of Planet Comics, I’d like to tell fun, imaginative stories under a sci-fi umbrella. To that end, I’ve asked some of my friends to help out and I’m really happy with the result. If you agree, then I hope you’ll help us send this issue to print! If the campaign for this first issue is successful, I’d like to publish a total of four issues on a (roughly) quarterly schedule.
As an added throwback, this issue will be presented in an oversized, magazine format, leaving lots of room for wide landscapes and immersive action!
The book
So what’ll be included in this first issue? First, we’ve got “The Bulwark”, from myself and artist Andrea Schiavone. This story will be the book’s continuing feature, told in serialized chapters along the way. Here’s a quick preview!

The world's most unknown Monster Rag...err.....Mag.
collecting issues 1-3 of the most putrid pile of pulp in all the tri-state area!! Started in 2013, FIENDS began as an experiment (pretty much my life story...) in Home printing. It failed (like my life.....) but has continued on for the past 7 years as the Industry standard in Monsters beating the snot out of each other. This Monster Tome will collect the first 3 issues, 90+  Square bound pages with added art sequences,  All covers, added retro ads, and other goodies.  What more do you want?? Food and water???.........I swear........ FIENDS is my love letter to Creepy and Eerie, old Marvel Monster mags of the 70's and some good old EC thrown in for good measure. Fans of the classic 70's Monster mags and Saturday Monster Shows will dig Fiends.....if you don't dig it, you can always bury it out back and let someone else dig it up.
The goal will be to eventually do a second volume, and create a cool case of some kind to put them in.....but we will worry about that down the road.
Where it all began. A dark eve.....a home printer.....a stack of porn mags.....errrr....i mean, a will to live.....ahhh screw it. This was the first mini issue with a first print run of under 50 copies......good luck finding this sucka!!

Issue 3's Tribute to Eerie Publications cover.....The kiddies loved this one!
Monster Tome Collected Fiends reg cover. Yeah....Our supply of these RARE 70's mags isn't in the best shape....but we found 'em in an old barn!!! what do you want from us??
Eerie Publications Tribute cover by Tim Tyler

To kill Cthulhu from issue 2......new pages will be added to this to make it the best version possible....I may even bleed on them a little.
From issue 3's Heart of the Howling beast. Werewolf versus Blind Templars!!! It's like Christmas morning!!!
Nazi Ghouls dropping from the skies!!! SWEEEEEET!!!!
Giant monster, sluggin' it out like Grandpaw and Grandmaw used to do!!!
Thought provoking tales of Love and Passion. Deep, meaningful Yarns that will make your one good eye tear up!!
You can't see THIS stuff on Animal Planet!!!!

SPAWN AND BATMAN, THE TEENAGE MUTANT NINJA TURTLES AND USAGI YOJIMBO, SUPERMAN AND MADMAN, THE SAVAGE DRAGON AND LITERALLY EVERYBODY!!! 
But now, in 2020, two of Indie Comics darlings are teaming up for one crazy adventure that can only be described in one word. JAMBOREE! THE BABOON AND PINK LEMONADE meet and team-up for the very first time! 
 I was reading a bunch of 90s Image comics and reignited my love of the crossover. Characters bouncing back and forth between books, binding characters to some great collective omni-narrative. It was fun. And I’ve been missing that fun. So I hit up my friend, and fellow cartoonist, Nick Cagnetti to see if he missed that fun too…
HE DID and we got working on a story that would link The Baboon and Pink Lemonade!
 It's comic con and Jamie AKA Monkey Bones AKA the Baboon's ward and nephew is super excited to meet his favorite cartoon star, the one and only OJ BOT! But, things go from "Awesome!" to "Awe crud..." when the Baboon and Monkey Bones run into an old foe, Dr. DeLumenex!
 Luckily for the pair fellow heroine and adventure, PINK LEMONADE is also at the con! Together, The Baboon, Monkey Bones, and Pink Lemonade must team up to stop Dr. DeLumenex or the most celebrated of nerd days, Comic Con, will be ruined!
 THE JAMBOREE! was Co-written by Jamie and Nick, Penciled and Inked by Jamie Jones, and Colored by Nick Cagnetti.  
 This is a small goal on purpose. Nick and I were going to just print stuff up to sell at cons, but with so many cancelled shows we've pivoted, but still want to go straight to the consumer. So, It's books, books, and more books. The Jamboree, The Baboon, and some sketches. 
This Kickstarter is like our own little convention! 
WHO'S  WHO CARTOONIST EDITION
Jamie Jones is a Florida born cartoonists whose works include, Quarter Killer (Comixology Originals), Kicking Ice (Ominous Studios) Lucha Underground (El Rey), Five Ghosts Special, and A Constant Distraction backup stories for Violent Love (Image) Puerto Rico Strong (Lion Forge) and has self published Dodger: A Western Saga of Mechs and Mayhem, and his ongoing anthology project, The Whisper. He is currently working on the second Baboon book and The Baboon Strip!
Nick Cagnetti is a 25 year old cartoonist from Phoenix, AZ. He's been drawing forever with a life-long love for comic books and has been making his own since 2012. His earlier works included drawing the series Infinite Wonders, and also The Spirit of The Shadows. Nick has done work in production design, storyboarding, commercial art, along with short comic stories appearing in anthologies from A Wave Blue World and covers for Chapterhouse Books. In 2016, he started writing and drawing his own comic strips, titled Pink Lemonade. The Pink Lemonade character expanded into her own comic book series in 2019, which brings us to where we're at now.

If you are a retailer and would like to have this awesome crossover comic in your shop please reach out to me privately at artofjamiejones@gmail.com. I would love to work with you directly, for this and future projects!

Discover how you can turn your art skills into your own thriving career in Illustration. 
FACT: Being an Illustrator is tough!
You have hopes and dreams to make it big as an artist; but you don't know how to make it happen. Still, you push along doing the best that you can. Yet, as you move forward you can't help but feel stress & anxiety about the future. "Will I actually succeed with my art?" "Is it even possible to find an art career that will pay my bills and  fulfill me creatively?" To make things worse, you sometimes cave into your fears because of social distancing and/or your past.
Well, listen up! If you want to earn a solid living with your art skills, if you want to be recognized for your brand/content, or if you simply want to land your dream art job, then you need to read what I'm going to say...

Cafe AU Lait is an anthology of short comics inspired by our love of the Coffee Shop Alternate Universe trope. Twelve comic creators from Australia and New Zealand come together to bring you eleven original short romance comics with Coffee Shop AU vibes. A familiar warmth, an every day romance, a touch of magic, even coffee in space! - each comic has a different approach to the theme, and the resulting collection features a variety of romantic relationships at different stages, from the very beginnings of something to rocky recovery. 
The book! With lovely cover art by Hawberries!
Wait, what's a Coffee Shop AU? A Coffee Shop Alternate Universe (or "AU") is when a creator takes well-known characters out of their usual canon stories and places them in the familiar, modern-day setting of a coffee shop. Coffee Shop AU stories are usually something fun and light, and though the stories in Cafe AU Lait are entirely original with original characters, we wanted to make stories in that tradition of fun, light, romance fanfiction.
Left - by Timothy Delaney | Right - by Cameron Davis
The coffee crew includes: Holly Adkins, Cameron Davis, Tim Delaney, Michel Gerencir, Phee Hawberries, Jennifer Reuter, Briar Rolfe, Alyce Sarich, Teloka and Miss Pi, Samantha "Mamath" Calcraft and Sid Stones.
A smorgasbord of Oceanic artists!
Cafe AU Lait is 95% ready to go, with almost all art complete from our creators. The anthology will be printed locally (in Australia!) and should have a fast turnaround since we are working with trusted printers who have produced high-quality work for us before. This means you won’t be waiting long for the anthology to be in your hands, and we expect to be able to start shipping out the book in September.
From left to right, art by: Phee Hawberries, Holly Adkins, and Jennifer Reuter
All of the artists on Cafe AU Lait have already received a base page-rate because we are passionate about artists being paid for their work (before everyone else has taken their cut). With your help, we can raise enough funds to print the book and then to give our creators more dollars for their excellent and enthusiastic work.
From "Bean Me Up" by Briar Rolfe
Ready to see what you can get out of this campaign? Along with the book, we've created some awesome coffee shop themed rewards for you, which are both cute and practical!
THE MAIN EVENT
The biggest anthology we've made yet! Priced at only $20 AUD for a book that will contain well over 140 pages of comics content, we believe it is a steal! Including non-comics pages (like title pages, spacers, info etc) this thing is going to clock in around 180 pages. :0

If you've been needing a fresh profile pic for all those Zoom calls, consider something simple and sweet like our art cards!
We can paint animals, people, characters, you name it!
Loads of options!!
Ready to support? We've a wide array of options to choose from! If you don't see exactly what you want, refer to our add-on menu to craft your own rewards package. Feel free to ask questions if you need clarification, we're here to help! :)
Wanting to add an item to your pledge? No problem! Use our handy add-on menu! Simply add the correct additional amount to your existing pledge for physical rewards to cover the extra items you want and fill out the survey we send out after campaign end to tell us which items you want added. We'll cross check with your pledge $$ and adjust your reward package accordingly. :) 
Unfortunately, Digital reward only pledges can not add physical rewards. If you're determined to get the digital tier but also want a non-book physical reward, please contact us. We will calculate shipping just for you and confirm the correct amount to pledge.
*ATTENTION INTERNATIONAL PLEDGE ADD-ONS: If you add any extra rewards, you must also add an additional $6 (AUD) to your pledge to cover the extra shipping cost involved. This is because we estimate the book will weigh close to 250grams once packed to ship, so any additional weight (even one coaster) is likely to push your package up into the next weight bracket for shipping purposes. DOMESTIC PLEDGE ADD-ONS: Additional shipping cost for you is already covered in the add-on costs in the menu.
2 stretch goals down!
Our first goal of $7000 AUD let's us do the bare minimum of printing a small run of books. Throw us some extra coffee dollars though and we'll be able to do even more! More books, better quality printing, and additional payments to our contributors, who absolutely deserve it.

campaign.story:
An era of Nintendo Magazines
Once upon a time, there was no internet. We know - crazy, eh? In this technologically-challenged era, Nintendo fans garnered their knowledge and wisdom from print magazines. There are far too many to mention here, but personal favourites of ours included Mean Machines (before it evolved like a Pokémon into Nintendo Magazine System), Total!, Super Play, Cube, NGamer and of course the Official Nintendo Magazine itself. These magazines were bursting with passion, knowledge and coverage for the consoles that we loved so dearly. Overseas readers will no doubt remember their own (sometimes official) publications, such as the legendary Nintendo Power.
The internet (and specifically, video coverage) may be winning now in terms of content and delivery, but there are still those that yearn for the days of a print Nintendo magazine. Here in the UK, there hasn't been a dedicated Nintendo magazine since 2014. So, we think the time is right for a new one.
The final issues of some amazing Nintendo coverage. We miss all of these, do you?
So, what's this then?  
There's a hole in the market. As we said, with no Nintendo magazines at all in the UK since 2014 and the recent demise of corporate multi-format publications in general (like GamesMaster and GamesTM) there's a huge lack of Nintendo coverage in print form. Whilst there are enthusiast ventures available, we craved something that completely covered and encompassed Nintendo's vast history. Something that looks at the retro aspect and well as the new, with a fresh perspective on things. So, we thought we would make one: Ninty Fresh. Something that will cater for ALL of Nintendo. From NES to Switch.
Ninty Fresh? What's that all about?
Capturing what the magazine is about with the added benefit of a cheeky pun, the title Ninty Fresh tells you right from the get-go what we want to do. Imagine, if you will, a cross between EMAP's Nintendo Official Magazine, Future's Official Nintendo Magazine and a dash of Retro Gamer and NGamer and that's what we hope to be bringing, all with that Nintendo flavour and familiarity that older magazines brought you. But in 2020. And obviously, with no affiliation to those amazing magazines.
Making your own magazine without advertising support or huge corporate backing is challenging, so this first Issue of Ninty Fresh is going to be an A4 (210mmx297mm) 80-page page-turner and will contain a smorgasbord of Nintendo content crammed into those pages. And no adverts.
What will be in it?
Our intention is to bring a range of enjoyable content in each issue. With editorials looking at the latest big Nintendo story, what's happened since the last Nintendo magazines, huge cover features as well as system recaps and informative interviews, all interwoven with amazing artwork, the latest reviews and even some fun and games! Oh, and fan content. We want your stuff. Letters (or emails), tweets, questions, artwork - all that sort of thing. We will be in touch closer to the launch with more details about those bits.
We've already got an interview with former NOM Editor Tim Street, the legendary Chris Scullion, who has written a massive NES encyclopaedia, has written a NES retrospective, and we have a feature/retro review on why The Legend of Zelda: Wind Waker was incredible. These things are already written and in place.
This year also sees the celebration of 35 years of Super Mario, so it seemed timely to dedicate a huge section to Mario's history. Everything for this first issue is either in progress, already completed or is awaiting release (reviews); we'd say around 50% of the content is already prepared. We've also reached out to other former Nintendo magazine writers and collectively they've written around 1000 words for the feature.
Although not the final design, this is the sort of thing you can expect in Ninty Fresh
When will it come out?
We are targeting an early August release for this, but will keep you posted. Obviously, we are already hard at work putting this all together - around 50% of it is already completed. The release ultimately depends on whether it gets funded and when the funds are processed, but we are hoping to start shipping these out before the end of July.
Funding Target 
Speaking of funding, our target of £2000 will ensure that an 80-page print issue will be produced. However, we hope that we can make something much bigger in the future, and if enough people support it and show that there's demand. Helping us to produce this first issue gives us the platform and scope to make this evolve even more and we can even make this beefier.
As we said, we’re already in discussions with folks that used to be involved with Nintendo magazines and really want to be able to bring their fantastic writing back where it belongs - in print. We hope that this will be around for the long-haul; in fact even our spines are being designed so that they'll make a pretty picture when put together. We'd need a fair few successful issues to achieve that!
If you like the sound of what we are doing, we have physical and digital options available, and some more premium levels if you really want to help this project come to life. Please help us get a print Nintendo magazine back into people's hands.
Stretch Goals
(Updated 2nd June 2020)
After smashing through our initial target, we have had a quick little brainstorm and amended/added new bits for you.
£5000 - NES Pin Badge! - Achieved!
Poor Jhon has hand-drawn every Nintendo console for us.
This shiny little beauty will be making its way to everyone that supported the print magazine or higher. PDF-only folks, can we tempt you?
£7500 - Famicom Pin Badge and Colouring-in Sheet
Get your mates to sign up for the premium level and we will hit this level Easily!
This will go nicely with the other one. You know you need it. We will also issue the cover as a line-art drawing so that you can colour it in if you are feeling artistic. Or better yet, give it to the kids. They can colour it in so you can read the magazine in peace!
£10,000 - Top Loading NES Pin Badge and Art Print
Yes, we've made three badges. You know you want them all!
£10000 - All issues of Ninty Fresh 01 will come packaged with a high-quality art print from the cover. And the little badge we initially said you'd get is now this one. So this stretch goal hasn't really changed, we've just added more badges to help us get there.
How can you help?
For starters, even supporting our little thing is humbling. Whether you pledge for a PDF version of the magazine, the print copy, or one of the heavier tiers, your support is what will make this happen. We absolutely love Nintendo and its games, and just want to make something that brings more of that content to more eyes. Beyond that, sharing this Kickstarter, telling your friends and pushing it far and wide. The more people supporting this, the more likely it'll not only become a reality, but allow us to make something even better and bigger in the future. And perhaps even more regular.
And, as noted in some of the masses of words above, we will need your letters (emails), and tweets. Pictures and stuff. These magazines in the past were almost communities within themselves. You got a ticket, right?

Bolt Action 2!! My 10th Kick Campaign and the follow up to one of the most unique comics out there. Ask anyone who backed Bolt #1 and they will agree...This is unlike anything out there and it's only gotten better with this new issue. Face it....Comic shops are in serious need of fresh Comics. The same old, same old crap that the Big Boys spoon out just doesn't cut it any longer. Quality has been traded for Political Agendas and Gender Politics. Forgettable stories and Coloring Book level art is the name of the game for most new titles.  
But there are Independent alternatives that if allowed, could fill those disappointing comic shelves with fresh goodness. Enter Rat House and the second killer issue of Bolt Action.
Bolt Action is an Illustrated Grind-house experience, complete with Trailers, sneak peeks and full features. Anything and everything can happen at the Bolt, a Supernatural Movie House that appears at Midnight, entertains those who possess  tickets, then fades away by sun-up. All Film Genres can be seen at the Bolt, from Horror, Action, Crime, R-Rated, Animated etc....You never know what's on the bill until you open the book and check out the Marquee. It's an Illustrated night on 42nd street, watching some kick ass new Grindhouse flick. 
Bolt Action is 60+ pages, in a square bound magazine format. It comes with its own Movie ticket and Illustrated folder which features it's own unique Movie trailer.
 The people who bought issue #1 knows what this is all about.  Just a fun Magazine style comic. No Woke. No Politics. Lots of Boobs and car crashes. What more could you want?
 Lots of items at different price points to allow everyone to enjoy this issue, so let's get to it. Just make sure you have that Ticket.
 The Bolt theater. A legendary Movie House that was burned to the ground on a Wintry night 80 years ago with a full house. Nobody escaped the Hell Storm that black eve including the entire Bolt Crew. The fire and the dead,  soon faded from memory--But the Spirit of the Bolt wasn't ready to be forgotten. Now, every so often, the Ghostly Theater returns from the other realm, to show fantastic, never before seen films and features. Movies you've never heard of, Directors that you've never read about. Unique Cinema that are now documented in the pages of Bolt Action. The head Usher Rhonda is your guide starting at Midnight until Sun up. If you have a Ticket, and know where the line begins, you too can enjoy a night at the BOLT.

The friendly staff at the Bolt Drive-In are always on the ball....but you BETTER have that ticket.

Still shipping. prob 75 to 80% finished. For a one person operation, I guess it is going good. I like to see boxes of books disappear. (But now, Collected Fiends comes in Monday, so the dwindling piles of boxes are soon going to grow again. 
 Just in case you are interested, I have a patreon site for Rat House where I show weekly pages, un-published art, commission work and new stories. Eventually, I want to do videos of the production and creating process for these Kickstarter projects....Subs start at 5.00 a month for all access. Higher tiers includes other physical goodies. Not everyones cup of tea, but if interested in supporting Rat House, it would be much appreciated. link below. Thanks!!

Shipping has begun. I'm going through each Tier at a time, cause I have no help, so please have patience. If you get a survey, then I am pretty much working on your Tier. Thanks for the Interest and support. I know this one took a while longer to get out. Let's hope 2021 is more stable.........I may have spoken too soon. There are a few more covers that aren't pictured like the second edition #1 and the shredded #2. Collected Fiends will ship out after these are out and on the way.

Items still arriving from the printers. We now have the Holo Foils and patches in, which covers certain tiers. Waiting on the main books, which should be leaving the printers real soon. I will begin sending surveys the day I hear they are packed and going out.
Grail One, the new campaign started today. please check it out if you are interested. more updates to come.

Proofs are in, and Printing has begun last week. I use 3 different companies to print the regular books, Holo foils, cd's and other things. I would say that the main books should ship this coming week to me....but the holidays may or may not slow it up...we'll see. Holo-Foils are being done by a company that has been a bit slow in the past...but again, we'll see. ( Not too many choices out there as far as metal and foil printing.) They might want to wrap up all their jobs before the new year. So all in all, I would say these will begin to ship out in the next few weeks....hopefully faster. I am usually ahead of schedule, but this has been a terrible year for business of all kinds. Let's hope 2021 is the OPPOSITE of 2020. GRAIL ONE is my next campaign, and will kind of connect to Bolt 2 in a way. In Bolt 2, The trailer to Maiden and Machine was introduced, but in Grail, they will have a full color, Heavy metal style adventure.

Digital Bolts have begun to go out to Digital backers. Bolt extras and special covers have arrived at the printers and will begin printing. I am waiting to ok the proof for the actual book. Fiends collected will be up next after Bolts have shipped.
My next kickstarter campaign will be GRAIL ONE, my version of the classic magazine Heavy Metal for 2021. Featuring Sci Fi and Fantasy stories done in a Mature fashion. Grail will also feature ongoing stories that I began in the past year like Devil Jack, Blood Reign,  Dead Crew and Psycho Tiger. Grail will be published through my other publishing company, SHADOW PLANET to set it apart from the Rat House material. Hopefully it will do well enough to be in full color and have some great guest Artists. Watch for the Campaign in the next few weeks.

Finishing up the main book this week. Will be off to the printer within the first part of Dec and prob start shipping the same month....unless the world catches fire.....or the lizard king awakens.....whichever comes  first I guess. For anybody who ordered FIENDS, it will ship after bolt. New campaign projects on the way. Thanks for your patience and support! For anyone interested, I have a Patreon page where I feature new comics, sneeks and un-published work. https://www.patreon.com/rathousecomics

Chugging along. Will finish up pimp Kain in about 4 or so more pages, then on to the final segments and the free Bolt times goodie. Pretty happy so far. Just wish all my promised help came through. I guess its true...If you want something done right, ( or at all.....) you pretty much just have to do it yourself. 
 I will be launching a new Magazine campaign, for Spring 2021 featuring all of my supernatural type characters. Blood Reign, Dead Crew (continued from Psycho Tiger #1) Devil jack, etc. Working title is REIGN but not sure if that is what I will go with. So basically Im condensing all my favorite characters and titles into 3 yearly magazines and or comics....Bolt Action, Fiends and Reign. That way, i can produce them on a more regular basis....that is, if the support and interest is there. You never know what will happen in times such as this. Comics don't seem to be doing well. Time will tell.

Still moving along. My Artist for the Italian story (An Italian Artist now that I think about it....) backed out on me at the last minute, so now I will have to illustrate his story. I was hoping for a few different art styles, but it looks like all me again. Story of my life....
So prob going to take a bit longer to do.....I dont want to rush it because its looking to be a fun issue. Im still trying to figure out how to add color. Any ideas? should I do a quick kick for it? a go fund me? if it hit its goal, everyone would get the upgrade. some stories look fine in black and white, but some would look even better in color.....im good either way.

Another random page from Bolt 2. The actual book will be in Black and White, like the first issue....but I would like to add color like I did on this sample page. Spot red for one story, Full color for another story, perhaps different color techniques to make it look like different films? i would have to do another short campaign to see if i can raise a small amount to add color. If I did and it was successful, everyone would receive the upgrade. I have always liked black and White myself.....but I would also love to see this issue in color. I would prob add more pages as well, so i wouldn't waste the chance to make it better than what i had planned. What do you think? You are the ones making these comics possible. I shouldn't delay the book much..maybe an extra week or two, but perhaps not at all since I'm coloring many pages just in case.

My name is Fran Garcés, an illustrator and digital artist based in the Canary Islands, Spain. You may know me as Dibujante Nocturno on Instagram or Facebook. 
Thank you for taking the time to check out this Kickstarter campaign for my art book Dibujante Nocturno: The Art of Fran Garcés. 
 Together with 3dtotal Publishing, I am creating a book that reflects who I really am as an artist, by giving insight into my creative experience and processes. The book will also include my ballpoint pen sketches, many of which I have scanned and colored especially for this project, and some new digital paintings, which I can't wait to share!
Dibujante Nocturno: The Art of Fran Garcés will be beautifully presented in hardback with grained leather-effect binding and gunmetal foiling, making it a stunning addition to your art book collection. 
I see my sketchbooks as personal journals, recording important thoughts and moments in my creative journey. To offer a glimpse into my artistic mindset, I have chosen to include unseen personal sketches in this book, accompanied by notes and inner musings.
In addition to showcasing diverse galleries of my fantastical works, I will be sharing my workflow through a series of step-by-step tutorials and a collection of tips and tricks I have learned over the years as a freelance artist. Through this book I hope that I can help you to grow and develop as artists and offer inspiration for years to come.
I hope you will consider supporting this project to help make this book a reality. Thank you all very much!
Below are the exclusive items that are available in addition to the book. Some tiers and gifts are limited, so be sure to pledge quickly if you don’t want to miss out! We have put a lot of love into these items and we hope you enjoy them.
Please note that as this is a live project, all designs are examples of content I would like to include but these are subject to change.




 Launching this book through Kickstarter means we can thank those who support the book by adding extra stretch goal rewards to the campaign. I have designed high-quality bonus rewards to be given away if we can meet certain targets.






3dtotal like to give the best and most exciting stretch goals possible to their backers. For that reason we only reveal one stretch goal at a time. This allows us to respond to the success of the campaign, offering more exciting and adventurous items when the campaign does well, rather than having committed to multiple smaller inexpensive products.

3dtotal publishing is committed to having a positive effect on the environment. From 2020 they have committed to planting one tree for every book they sell by partnering with re-forestation charities. This includes books sold in their Kickstarter campaigns. If you support this campaign we would like to thank you for helping us take on this mission.
3dtotal Publishing is able to ship worldwide! Simply select your pledge option and your location, and Kickstarter will calculate the shipping for you.
All rewards will be sent out at the same time (both signed and unsigned). However, if there is a very high number of backers, please keep in mind that it will take us a few days to work our way through packaging all the rewards. 3dtotal Publishing has a fulfilment company lined up to do this as quickly as possible, so once dispatched, rewards should reach you in 10-15 working days.
We have fulfilled many successful Kickstarters and we have a great record for delivering parcels around the world. For this campaign we will be offering tracked shipping to certain locations as we're really determined that you receive your parcel first time without any hiccups or problems with delivery. Parcels sent to the UK, USA and Europe will be sent using our regular and reliable service, and parcels sent to the rest of the world will be sent with tracked shipping. Due to complications to logistics caused by the Coronavirus, some countries have introduced surcharges to receiving international postage. This is why shipping prices will seem slightly higher for some backers than it has done on our past campaigns.
Unforeseen delays that are out of our control can occur during delivery, so please allow an additional two weeks before checking up on your package. We will be doing our best to make sure everything gets to you on time!
For those who are not familiar with Kickstarter, it’s a worldwide crowd-funding platform for artists and their creative projects. Once the funding period ends, we will start finalizing the book and the extra rewards, which will be sent to you in October. About a month before that, we will send you a survey through Kickstarter, asking for your address – the reason we wait until a few weeks before is so that we have everyone’s most up-to-date details. When the survey is ready for you to fill in, you will receive an email through Kickstarter. We ask that you fill the survey in as soon as possible, to avoid any delays in sending out your reward!

campaign.story:
ERIS is a sci-fi action comic exploring violence, consciousness, power, and masculinity.  The story is planned to span three 32 page full color issues.
The story follows a team of super-powered humans on an assassination mission to the edge of the known universe. Each member of this elite unit must wrestle with their role in the power structures of earth as they are pushed to their mental and physical limits.
PREVIEW:
Here's a preview of ERIS to give you a taste of the insane world we've built:
We designed ERIS to capture the energy of 90’s comics, the thought-provoking formalism of alternative comics, and the excess of 80’s sci-fi action films. 
ERIS is 100% complete and ready to print!  This means when we hit our goal, the book can be immediately sent to the printers and ready to ship as soon as possible.  You won’t be waiting months and months for your reward to arrive, which we know is a huge bummer!
Here's what other comic creators are saying about ERIS:
"With ERIS, Tyrell is bringing a new voice to science fiction with a dynamic and blood fueled tale.  GET THIS!" -Daniel Warren Johnson, creator of Murder Falcon, Extremity and Wonder Woman: Dead Earth.
"ERIS is sci-fi action comics as they were meant to be: Big ideas and even bigger muscles." - Aubrey Sitterson, co-creator of No One Left to Fight and The Comic Book Story of Professional Wrestling
"This comic is hot as shit. No one draws like Tyrell Cannon." - Isabella Rotman,  co-creator of Wait What? A Comic Book Guide to Relationships, Bodies, and Growing Up and creator of This Might Hurt Tarot Deck,
...
ERIS theme song by J.L. Shioshita
ERIS title animation by Jonathan Lamantia
...
WHO WE ARE:
ERIS is created by the Cannon brothers, Tyrell & Logan.  They grew up on a steady diet of Arnold Schwarzenegger movies and Rob Liefeld comics in the golden age of Saturday morning cartoons!  Logan is an actor and writer, bringing his penchant for awesome movie lines to the ERIS script.  Tyrell is a comic artist and illustrator who has been making comics for over 15 years.  He is known for creating the ground-breaking sci-fi anthology Speculative Relationships, cover art for comics like Murder Falcon, as well as his own comics Victus and Gary.   Most recently, his DOOM-inspired inktober comic IDKFA lit up the internet with it’s brutal demon-killing action.
There is a lot of uncertainty in the world right now, especially in the comics industry.  We feel that what we can do is: KEEP MAKING AWESOME COMICS. ERIS is our gift to you during this crazy time.
...
 REWARDS
A high resolution PDF of ERIS #1. 32 Pages, full color.
A high quality, full size, staple bound copy of ERIS #1.  32 pages, full color.  Signed by Tyrell Cannon.  Early bird discount, so get it while it's hot!
The main event!  A high quality, full size, staple bound copy of ERIS #1.  32 pages, full color.  Signed by Tyrell Cannon
All previous rewards, PLUS 1 ERIS Logo sticker for you to put literally anywhere.
We love our local comic shops and we want to see our books on their shelves!  This includes 4 copies of ERIS #1 at a discounted rate.  Retailers only please.
A physical copy of ERIS #1, PLUS an original black and white 9x12” commission of your choice by Tyrell Cannon.  Below are some examples of Tyrell's commission work: 
A physical copy of ERIS #1, PLUS a piece of original art from the comic!  Pages will be chosen by backers in the order they contribute.  Each page is 11x17”, black and white ink, signed by the artist.  Here's a look at some of the original pages: 
...
 STRETCH GOALS
If we go over our goal, we add value for all backers, as well as bringing more content sooner. I firmly believe in stretch goals that provide more content and focus on the actual comic, rather than throwing in a bunch of unrelated knick-knacks.  In that spirit…
$4k: Artist Edition
As comic and movie fans, we LOVE special features.  Hearing from makers how they create expands the work, giving readers another level of appreciation for the book.  When this stretch goal is unlocked, we will offer an Artist Edition PDF of ERIS #1 to all backers.  This Artist Edition will include things like:
Thumbnail sketches of each page
  Raw scans of the artwork
  Color process guides
  Script pages
  Commentary on each page by Tyrell & Logan
  Development sketches
  A video walkthrough of each page of ERIS, with commentary by Tyrell
  We really want to make this available to readers, so let’s hit that goal!
$6k: Issue #2 Fast Track
WE WANT YOU TO READ ERIS #2 AS SOON AS POSSIBLE! Issue 2 is completely written and the thumbnailing has already started.  It is shaping up to be an insane action-packed issue.
Issue #1 of ERIS was drawn over the course of a year, in my “spare time” between my paid illustration and comics work.  It is a labor of love that I want to spend more time and attention on going forward.  When we hit this stretch goal, the funding will go towards making ERIS #2 my full-time focus for the 2 months directly following the campaign (and after orders are all shipped).  This means the story will continue without waiting another year!  Backers would get sneak peeks into the process during this time, followed by another kickstarter campaign to facilitate the costs printing/shipping of issue #2.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I (Tyrell) have run 4 successful kickstarter campaigns to date, delivering rewards safely and on-time to backers. I’ve self-published over 20 of my own comics, exhibited at many shows across the US, and am an organizer of the Chicago Alternative Comics Expo. This is, as they say, “not my first rodeo”. I know the many challenges of putting a comic together and getting it into the hands of readers. I will always meet these challenges with planning and communication.
The Covid-19 pandemic has already created many issues for comics and everyday life. We have checked with our printer and confirmed that they are operating and ready to go. We also have looked into multiple shipping options to have a plan for delivery. No doubt, more challenges could arise due to the current pandemic, but we will always be communicative and forward with our backers about the status of the project.

Tyrell here.  I wanted you all to know about a bummer of a situation: Despite our best efforts, my family and I recently contracted covid. The illness and taking care of each other put us out of working condition for about 2 1/2 weeks.  I'm finishing my quarantine period today, and was finally able to get back to the drawing table yesterday.

campaign.story:
”I first read this as a screenplay. Having myself experienced what can happen when a screenplay becomes a graphic novel, to say I'm excited by this Kickstarter is very much an understatement!” — William Gibson
MADI is a 260-page road trip graphic novel set in the near future, by film director Duncan Jones (MOON, SOURCE CODE) and writer Alex de Campi (BAD KARMA, BLADE RUNNER), and drawn by some of comics’ most exciting artists including Glenn Fabry, Simon Bisley, Duncan Fegredo and Pia Guerra. Each artist tackles a 8-30 page section of the story, bringing to life one location.
See for yourself: Download the first 19 pages of MADI here! Includes both the Fegredo/Phillips and Shimizu covers.
 This project is EU/UK shipping friendly! We are drop-shipping to a UK distributor so shipping is affordable to our huge and beloved European fanbase. Estimated maximum shipping costs for a single book are: US: $10 / Canada & Mexico: $15 / UK: $20 / Mainland Europe: $25 / Rest of World: $55. Shipping costs will be collected at checkout (after the campaign ends) via Backerkit, where you’ll also have the chance to add on additional books or upgrade to a higher-tier book. 
Madi Preston, a veteran of Britain’s elite special operations J-Squad unit, is burnt out and up to her eyeballs in debt. She and the rest of her team have retired from the military but are now trapped having to pay to service and maintain the technology put into them during their years of service.   They're working for British conglomerate Liberty Inc as  mercenaries, selling their unique ability to be remote controlled by specialists while in the field, and the debts are only growing as they get injured completing missions. We meet Madi as she decides she’s had enough.  She will take an off-the-books job that should earn her enough to pay out her and her sister, but when the piece of tech she’s supposed to steal turns out to be a kid, and she suddenly blacks out... she finds herself on the run from everyone she’s ever known. 
In a globe-spanning adventure from Shanghai to Soho, Madi has to stay one step ahead of the giant corporations closing in on her from all sides. 
MADI is the third and final story in the “Mooniverse,” an anthology of independent stories that take place in a shared future. You don’t need to have seen MOON or MUTE to fully enjoy this standalone book.
The full roster of line artists are: Dylan Teague, Glenn Fabry, Duncan Fegredo, LRNZ, Ed Ocaña, André Araújo, Simon Bisley, Rosemary Valero-O’Connell, Tonci Zonjic, Pia Guerra, James Stokoe, RM Guéra, Chris Weston,  Rufus Dayglo, Annie Wu, David Lopez and Christian Ward. Our amazing colour team includes: Matt Wilson, Nayoung Kim, Chris O’Halloran, Adam Brown, Jacob Phillips, Raúl Arnaiz, Giulia Brusco, Sergey Nazarov and Kelly Fitzpatrick. Lettering is by Alex. 
Every artist has been paid their full asking rate and is also getting royalties on the project. As freelancers ourselves, we believe in being the change we want to see in the industry.  
The book is almost finished being drawn and is currently being lettered. It will be sent to backers in early November, and comes in your choice of a luxe 7¼ X 10 ½” paperback, a 8.3” x 12” hardback (the original art size), or an oversize 10 x 14½” cased hardback with over 40 pages of back matter. The paperback cover is by Duncan Fegredo & Jacob Phillips, and the hardback cover is by Yuko Shimizu. 
Duncan Fegredo and Jacob Phillips' beautiful wrap cover for the paperback edition
Because both Duncan and Alex have big fanbases in Europe we are doing our damnedest to make sure shipping is as inexpensive as possible while maintaining safe and careful mailing of these extremely nice, high quality editions. We're working with drop-shipping to UK distributors so European buyers won't have to pay airmail from the US.  Backerkit is handling all our pledge management and will be charging shipping at the end, once the campaign is over (you'll also be able to add on books or upgrade your pledge at that time, if you want). Z2 has its own warehouse, so US fulfillment can be handled easily and professionally in-house. 
No digital version of MADI will be made available at this time, or indeed maybe ever.
Stores, you will be able to order MADI for retail sale at your fine shops a few weeks after Kickstarter fulfillment.  
Yuko Shimizu's luscious cover for the hardback edition
A model of Yuko's cover on the hardback, without logos (why interrupt the pretty until you have to)
The deluxe slipcase edition is truly a magnificent book, with the art reproduced at luscious 10” x 14.5” size (a 20% blowup on the book’s original art size of 8.3” x 12”) and with over 60 pages of extras, process, and essays from Duncan and Alex, along with surprise bonus art from friends like Colleen Doran and Jeffrey Veregge! See a scene go from original screenplay through Alex’s handwritten breakdowns to comic script, pencils, inks, then colours! Pore over the thumbnails and rough layouts of masters like Duncan Fegredo and RM Guéra! Enjoy all the character sketches and development work that went on behind the scenes (there was a lot, this project was super complex to produce) such as Annie Wu’s amazing Kitty Cop concept art, below! (The whole Kitty Cop origin story is pretty great, too, it basically involves Alex + too much sugar.) 
The Madi deluxe edition with diecut slipcase
The slipcase edition features Yuko’s gorgeous wrap cover without logos, inside a diecut slipcase that allows Yuko’s illustration of Madi to show through. This slipcase edition will not be available for retail sale; if you miss it here, maybe we might have a few at the Z2 Comics table at a convention, but maybe not. 
Annie Wu’s concept art for our Kitty Cops, or: “kawaii, but make it fascism”
Duncan Fegredo's lovely wrap cover for the softcover edition, before its colours by Jacob Phillips!
A Simon BIsley warmup sketch, as you do; another of the sort of extras that only come in the deluxe slipcase edition
Also, neither Duncan nor Alex have ANY chill so we'll probably post lots of lettered pages in the updates.... but only for backers.  
Duncan's last "Free the 156" stickers from MUTE, for the first 50 hardcover backers
 Who we are:
Man; made Moon & more
Duncan Jones is a British advertising and film director, best known for his BAFTA winning film MOON, epic game-based fantasy movie WARCRAFT and his other science fiction films SOURCE CODE & MUTE.  He is presently staying safely locked up at his home, waiting for it to be safe to go out and make ROGUE TROOPER of 2000AD fame with Rebellion Studios.  Duncan is answerable to his wife, Rodene, his two kids, Stenton 4 and Zowie 2, and his dog, who takes her privacy very seriously after a scamming incident, and wishes to remain anonymous. 
Woman; made books
Alex de Campi is a novellist and comics writer, best known for her noir graphic novel BAD GIRLS and her love anthology TWISTED ROMANCE, both of which were nominated for three Eisner awards last year. She has also written some episodes of Shinichiro Watanabe’s BLADE RUNNER anime (on Toonami next year) and worked with Masamune Shirow on a GHOST IN THE SHELL comic for Kodansha. Her debut novel, medieval suspense thriller THE SCOTTISH BOY, comes out at the end of the month and you can preorder it here in the UK or here in the US. You can read her action-thriller comic BAD KARMA anywhere in the world right now, as it is pay-what-you-wish on lovely webcomic site Panel Syndicate. Alex is answerable to her daughter Lorelei and her deafblind pit bull Tango, and they’re all answerable to the darn cat. Her little family is currently enjoying being the only people left in Manhattan.

campaign.story:
In 2014, I made a blacklight screen print with fluorescent ink with Telegraph Art & Comics. This is it: 
It made me think, why hasn't anyone made a blacklight comic book with fluorescent ink? These colors are so bright! It would be the best looking comic book ever.
So I decided to make one. It's called OCTOBRIANA 1976. 
OCTOBRIANA 1976 preview
It's about a badass Russian superhero/devil-woman who fights Soviet oppression and robot Stalin.
OCTOBRIANA 1976 preview
It's set in the 1970s because when I think of blacklight art, I think of the 70s. Plus the story is inspired by underground comix of the 70s.
OCTOBRIANA 1976 preview
Octobriana comes from the book Octobriana and the Russian Underground (1971) by Petr Sadecky. It's about a subversive group of artists and writers in Kiev in the 1960s who create a western-style superhero character as an act of dissent. They made outlaw comics called samizdat (publish-it-yourself <-- reminds me of zines in the US or dojinshi in Japan) that starred Octobriana. Sadecky smuggled this material out of the USSR for his book. Since then, Octobriana has appeared in several comic books across many decades and countries. She seemed like a perfect character for American underground comix - a show of solidarity with their Russian countercultural kin. 
Of course some of that is not true. It's a great book that reminds me of things like Orson Welles' War of the Worlds and F for Fake, Spinal Tap, or H.P. Lovecraft's mythology (specifically the way other writers are free to use his creations). Here is a Cartoonist Kayfabe video that Ed Piskor and I made about Sadecky's book:
OCTOBRIANA 1976 preview
In order to make this work, I'm teaming up with my frequent partner-in-creative - AdHouse Books' Chris Pitzer. Pitzer's my print guru. We first teamed up on the 1970s superhero graphic novel Afrodisiac. It featured some unusual printing/coloring/design to approximate the look of the time period: 
We also did Street Angel: Princess of Poverty. This was the first time I worked with fluorescent ink in offset printing (the cover lettering and spine). It's not the same as other ink. For example, you need to print it twice to "charge" it:
So when I first thought about making a blacklight comic book with fluorescent ink, I talked to AdHouse Books. His expertise is the reason this is going to be the best looking comic book ever!
REWARDS
UPDATE!!! I've created 3 editions of the digital OCTOBRIANA 1976 - Neon, Retro, and Black-and-white! These will be sent to everyone who backs this Kickstarter starting at the $5 level! Here are samples. I'm also making comic book editions of the retro and black-and-white versions:
REWARDS
OCTOBRIANA 1976 - DIGITAL EDITIONS 
Read these on your computer or mobile device. Because the fluorescent color doesn't translate well to the screen, I decided to create a custom digital copy of Octobriana 1976. The coloring is different than the print edition but I tried to make it look its best for your screen!
PROCESS: OCTOBRIANA 1976 ZINE
This is a cross between a how-to book and an Artist Edition. It features my script, layouts, sketches, and scans of the original art that went into the creation of Octobriana 1976.
OCTOBRIANA 1976 - PRINT EDITION 
This is why we're all here - 24 page, saddle-stitched comic book featuring bright, fluorescent colors! Is it the best looking comic book ever? Get one and decide for yourself. If you or someone you know loves comics, printed matter, or design - this is for you!
 UPDATE!!! I've created 3 editions of the digital OCTOBRIANA 1976 - Neon, Retro, and Black-and-white! I like how they look so I'm going to make limited print editions of the Retro and Black-and-white versions. If you've already chosen another Reward but you'd like to add these variant editions - you will be able to add them when you check out at the end of this campaign:
BLACKLIGHT SCREEN PRINTS Signed and Numbered
In addition to the comic book, I'm offering signed and numbered blacklight screen prints as rewards, including the Dragon Killer print that started this journey plus an Octobriana print and Afrodisiac print - it is her Kickstarter after all! You can also get a set of all three for a nice price. Prints are 18 x 24 inches.   
UPDATE: Afrodisiac package REWARD is now available - Octobriana 1976 comic book + Afrodisiac book + Afrodisiac blacklight screen print
UPDATE: I have added 2 prints for a very limited 5 print set. The 2 prints are from previous print runs and limited quantities. One is a blacklight screen print based on Alexis Ziritt's comic book Space Riders. The other is a 3D screen print for Plan 9 from Outer Space. Both prints are 18 x 24 inches.

ART
Octobriana drawings on comic book backing boards. The drawings pictured below are samples of what some of these backboard drawings look like. The drawings will vary since each is a unique, one-of-a-kind drawing and not a print.  Backing boards are approximately 6.75 x 10.5 inches. Media is pencil, ink, marker, paint, highlighter, color pencil, or mixed media. The backing board will be in a plastic sleeve along with your copy of Octobriana 1976 comic book. 
ORIGINAL ART: STRETCH GOAL BOOKPLATE DRAWING
The original art for the Stretch Goal Bookplate/Signed Print. It is ink on bristol, 11 x 17 inches.
ORIGINAL ART: DRAGONKILLER
The original art from the Dragonkiller blacklight print is now available. It is archival ink on bristol, 18 x 24 inches.
Detail:
There are a few concept drawings available as rewards. These are character drawings that I made when I was working out the designs, materials, and style of OCTOBRIANA 1976. These concept drawings are 11 x 17, ink on bristol.  
Concept drawing 1
Concept drawing 2
Concept drawing 3
The cover art is also a Reward and 11 x 17, ink and screen tone on bristol.

STRETCH GOALS
UNLOCKED! $60,000 - Octobriana Checklist: Old school fanzine style! Where else has Octobriana appeared? I'll try to make a comprehensive list of appearances in comic books as well as real world media.
$75,000 - Signed bookplate/print: This will be included with the Print edition OCTOBRIANA 1976 fluorescent, blacklight comic book. It will feature a new drawing and design by Jim Rugg! I'm not saying it will be from OCTOBRIANA 1986...but that was a magical year for comics. I'm sure the goddess of war had something to say about it!
FINAL NOTE
Eventually I plan to distribute this comic book anywhere and everywhere that I can. This includes comic book shops, conventions, and online. I do not know how those details will unfold, but I want to be honest about my intentions. My goal is to make comics accessible to readers everywhere. 
Thank you for your support and read more comics!

A few years later in 1995, the first Spawn action figure was released to retail and critical acclaim helping to usher in a whole new way of giving you much detailed and ‘art’ to your action figures. Now, twenty-five years later, Todd McFarlane is joining forces with Kickstarter to help deliver an updated version of that original 1995 toy & comic release. 
ABOUT THE FIGURE
This figure will be 7 inches tall and come with a huge folding cape and weapon. The articulation in this version will be more than double what the original toy had, and the included comic cover will be re-drawn by the international award-winning artist and creator of the Spawn character, Todd McFarlane.

campaign.story:
The war is remembered in hushed whispers and dread. Humanity creating its own demons in the form of the weapons it forged. Though the conflict has long ended these dangers remain. Hong Kong is now one giant bazaar selling anything your heart desires. Encrypted black ice, tame plagues and multi-phase rifles are now sold alongside the flesh and crime of the old city. Those who look further still will find the true horrors hiding in the dark corners of the city and all have a price tag attached.
Only a select few walk this beat any more. One such soldier now works for the United Nations Weapon Inspection team, tasked with removing errant dangers from the public's possession.
Her name is King.
Update:
Due to the amazing support and success of this project I am happy to announce the stretch goals, with all three having now been met! So if your already backing me then thank you! If not then keep scrolling down to find out more about the book and join us on this awesome ride.
The Book.
Grenade is a graphic novel that I am in the process of making. The core of the story follows the efforts of Inspector King as she and her partner strive to keep the cyberpunk city of Hong Kong safe. The future is filled with a wide array of fantastical and horrifying weapons and it is their job to protect the public and seize any such items.
I'm wanting to create a story that will capture the imagination and also give the reader a real journey through the future Hong Kong I'm illustrating. Filled of course with a colourful cast of heroes, villains and con-artists.
Here are the first few pages to give you a feel for the project.
The book itself will be 120-130 pages long, A5 sized (148mm x 210mm) and Hardcover. This is because I want to create something that will feel great in your hands as you settle down to read the finished product. The story within will be a stand alone tale. So there will be no hanging around or the sequel. Just a great story to enjoy on its own.
This image is not the finalised cover.
 The reason I chose to use kickstarter is simple. I wanted to be to pitch my idea for a book straight to you, the reader. You're the only one I'm trying to impress with this idea. Rather than pitch to a publisher I want you to be the reason I'm working on this, pure and simple.
About Me.
I've been drawing since I was little and drawing comics on the small press scene for almost 10 years. I have grown in that time and now my work will soon be appearing in Image Comics "Island". I have also self published a range of comics including my series "The Sea" and "Tuk Tuk". 
Raised and living in Sheffield in the UK I studied graphic design and now work or myself as an illustrator/comic artist. The only thing I've been doing as long as I have been into drawing is roleplaying. So I guess I'm a terminal geek...
The Rewards.
We all know the book is the thing but your probably wondering what about the other things offered in the rewards. 
Also as a side note where it reads Tyrant in the rewards this is in reference to the old name of the book. The book will be exactly the same just named Grenade. 
Well every tier will receive a digital copy of the finished book just as soon as it is finished. I will also be emailing out sneak peeks and pages on a regular email to all backers while I work through the project.
The postcard sized prints will have 5 different designs and will be printed on high quality card stock. The illustrations will be solely on these prints and will only be available through the Kickstarter.
A personalised drawing in your book. This will be an ink sketch of your fine self or your avatar, drawn as though you are a part of the Grenade world, on the inside cover of the book.
The character illustrations on reward five will be full length Illustrations of a character of your choosing. It could be from my book, your book, a roleplaying character or anyone really. You will receive the original pencils with your book and an email containing the finished colour version in high res.
The A3 (420mm x 297mm) can be anything you want. As with the previous reward you will be sent the original pencils along with your book and an email with the finished colour version.
The Final reward tier is the chance for up to 5 people to role-play in a custom written adventure set in the world of Grenade. You will create your own character and explore Hong Kong under the guidance o myself as GM. I will run the game over Skype for your group or if you are in the uk I will come to you if your prefer. Along with this I will illustrate your characters for the game and of course you'll all get your copy of the book too. So why not share the cost and come adventuring.
campaign.risks:

The main risk I face on this project is that this will be the biggest book I have made to date. Though I have plenty of experience on smaller projects, this will be the most time consuming. Also given the page count there is always the risk that I could fall behind. I plan to keep in regular contact with all my backers and keep them up to date with my progress so they can see the project evolve.

The Show 
Cannon Busters is an animated adventure about the value of friendship and just how far one is willing to go to maintain it. If The Wizard of Oz met the Hidden Fortress with influences derived from Escaflowne, hip-hop, and classic RPGs -- you get Cannon Busters, one wild ride of fun, suspense, action, and wackiness. It's a roadshow-style adventure of epic proportions!

The Story
Follow the adventures and exploits of S.A.M, a high-end, royal-class friendship droid who's joined by a quirky, discarded maintenance robot and a brash, deadly fugitive. Together, the unlikely trio embarks on an unforgettable journey in a fantastic and dangerous world in search of S.A.M's best friend, the heir to a powerful kingdom under siege.
The Main Characters
The World
The story takes place hundreds of years ago in the vast and magical world of Gearbolt. As the centuries passed, the practice of magic became extinct, and many have forgotten its power, regulating it to mere superstition…
The Project
Cannon Busters is an animated project created by TV animation producer/director LeSean Thomas. The goal is to produce a 8-10 minute pilot episode (1 act) through Kickstarter. We're looking to you to help us raise, at the very least, the minimum goal of $120,000 (8-10 minutes). If we surpass our minimum goal, our stretch goals will increase the length of the episode by 8-16 minutes, ultimately providing us the funds to create and develop a full 24-minute episode!
The Team Players
Here's some of the team members who you'll be supporting to help bring Cannon Busters to life!
 LeSean Thomas, Creator/Director/Writer (https://twitter.com/LeSeanThomas)
LeSean Thomas has contributed to television animation in the United States for over 10 years. His most notable works include Peabody Award-winning series The Boondocks on Adult Swim serving as Co-Director (Season 1) and Supervising Character Designer (Seasons 1 & 2), Nickelodeon's The Legend Of Korra (Book 1) as a storyboard/production artist, and most recently Black Dynamite: The Animated Series as Creative Producer (Season 1) and Supervising Director (Seasons 1 & 2) on Adult Swim.
Recently, Thomas spent several years working abroad in South Korea as an animation production/storyboard artist, honing his skills and developing Cannon Busters while lending his talent to hit shows. He is driven by his passion and enthusiasm for animation production and enjoys sharing his knowledge with the animation & art community online. Drawing from Western and Eastern influences, Thomas's work displays a level of stylistic expression and dynamism that makes him highly distinguishable among his peers. Through his unique vision and your support, he hopes to bring Cannon Busters to life!
Joe Madureira, Contributing Character Designer (http://www.airshipsyndicate.com)
One of the most influential artists working today, Joe Madureira is a celebrated comic book creator, illustrator, and game developer. His breakout work on titles such as Marvel's Uncanny X-Men and his creator-owned comic book Battle Chasers has earned him much acclaim. He also served as Creative Director for the hit video game series Darksiders (1&2). Madureira's energetic and distinctive style combines Western comic book influences with aspects of Japanese manga. I write and draw the "Sharknife" series of graphic novels, as well as the advanced kickball comic "PENG!", and the space-grape action adventure "Seedless". You may have also seen my work in Marvel's "Nation X" and "Strange Tales" anthologies, as well as the "Avatar: The Last Airbender, Lost Adventures" graphic novel.

For the last three years I've self-published a black & white comics anthology series called "Layered Jacket" and released them at the Emerald City Comic Con, annually. 

This year I'd like to do something a little next level. 
Presenting "SUN BAKERY" my first ever full-color self-published project! 
Sun Bakery is a comics anthology / art book / design container. The first volume will feature THREE unique comic stories, all in their own varied styles, sporting a variety of themes. Along with the comics will be an artwork / illustration section, making Sun Bakery a hybrid comic book / art book.  Along with all that, Sun Bakery will have some written columns, microcomics, and most definitely some eye-popping design.

The following are the contents of Sun Bakery #1!
-- THE COMICS --
"LAZER JACKET"
Continuing in the tradition of "Layered Jacket" comes the birth of a new Magic Jacket-wielding Persona. Jim Thompson is an above-average scientist with a major personal problem that overflows into his work. When personalities clash, it gives way to a mistaken biproduct: A jacket made of matter undocumented by mankind-- A tool of precision world-building, or utter destruction. Is Jim-- now more than a mere human-- friend or foe? 
"COCKFIGHT"
It's a blood-sport most don't care to acknowledge. But to a certain sect of individuals, rooster battling is the ultimate past time. However, in this world, it's not just the chickens in danger. Whatever pain is inflicted upon the losing rooster, is also inflicted upon it's master. It's high risk, man meets animal action. Featuring characters from my long-running series of illustrations, the Skeletal Scarf Ninjas.
"THE GOOD & THE FOWL"
When the president's daughter is kidnapped, it's up to LJ and the Unnamed Black Knuckle Swordsman to defeat the Panang Chain Gang and recover her! But what happens when you're too hungry to continue?
Originally seen online, this Layered Jacket side-story is finally printed in all it's 3-color glory. BUT ALSO with an extended ending that shifts LJ's world into a realm he never expected!
-- THE ARTWORK --
In addition to the comic sections, Sun Bakery will have an artwork / illustration section. A lot of these are various marker drawings, commissions, fan art from comics, anime & video games, drawings done online, or for fun. 
Example pages from the gallery
